moves.1. e4 e5 2. a4 a6: Black seems to do well with Nf6, according to the database.  Pa6 is not recorded.
moves.3... d6 4. g4 Nc6 5. Ne2: This blocks the queen's protection of Pg4.
moves.5... Bxg4 6. h3 Bh5: I like Bf3 better.  Threatens the rook, picks off Pe4.
moves.7. d3 Nf6 8. Bg2 Nd4 9. f3 Nxf3+: And after trading bishop for knight black picks up another pawn.
moves.13... Qd7 14. Nd2: I like QxPh3 here.  That defends Bf3 from NxB.
moves.14... Bxe2 15. Qxe2 Nf4: I still like QxP, which leaves the queen defending Nh5.
moves.16. Qg4: Now here NxPd3+ seems like a fun idea.
moves.16... Qxg4 17. Rxg4 O-O-O 18. b4 Nxd3+ 1: Oh my.  Nf2+ forks Rg4, trading the knight for white's rook.
White is unwise trading while behind.
moves.33. Bxc3 Rxh3 34. Bxd4 exd4 35. Rf5 Kc6: Rd5 is a better move for white.  Black cannot defend Pd4 with it.
moves.36... Re3 37. e5: That pawn is gone.  White would be better off molesting Ph7.
moves.39. Rxh7 Kc4: Nope.  Pc6 protects that vulnerable pawn, however.
